intro: Monactis holwayae, commonly known as the Holway’s monactis, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming during the summer months. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
